text: If you’re looking for good pet insurance, you’ve found the right one with Spot Pet Insurance! My cat was recently diagnosed with asthma, which is pretty expense to find out. Thankfully she was insured by Spot, and once we hit her deductible (which only took one visit that required X-rays and a blood test) we began to receive a 70% reimbursement on costs. Now I don’t have to stress about the finances when it comes to treating her asthma. The reimbursement process is simple and fast, and I’m grateful her illness is covered. Worth the monthly price of coverage for sure!

I think every pet needs health insurance just like their humans and it’s a worthwhile monthly expense, especially for us.

text:
We give Spot two paws up!

The website made it clear what was needed to file a claim, our claims were processed quickly, and the reimbursement for both an emergency visit and illness visit were fair. 

We have not experienced this level of service with other pet insurance companies, so we recommend going with Spot!
title: Great Service and Reimbursement!

text: I'm extremely dissatisfied with the handling of my claims. My pet was diagnosed with cancer 1 day after his policy went into effect. Despite my repeated attempts to provide all necessary records, it took over a month for any progress to be made. Neither myself nor my clinic spared any effort in supplying the required documentation, only to be met with further delays. When I finally requested to speak to a supervisor, I was blindsided by the revelation that my claim wouldn't proceed due to a previously undisclosed requirement for “two years worth of records.” This information should have been made clear from the start, sparing me the wasted time and money on a policy. Frustrated, I promptly requested to cancel my policy as it was proven futile. Yet, to add insult to injury, I received notification today, over a month later, that my claim was miraculously processed. This entire ordeal has left me feeling utterly disrespected and undervalued as a customer. I am deeply convinced that my claims were only processed because I cancelled my policy. Now, faced with the devastating news of my pet's cancer diagnosis, I find myself in an even more precarious situation. Any other insurance provider would likely classify this as a pre-existing condition, leaving me without the financial support I need during this emotionally and financially taxing time. This leaves me with no choice but to either reinstate my policy with SPOT or face the prospect of having no insurance coverage at all, compounding the stress and burden I'm already under. This situation has been an entirely terrible experience, and I’m extremely upset with how deceiving everything has been.
title: They don’t care until you cancel

text:
HORRIFIC experience. This company is literally a scam. They are denying an allergy claim on a kitten (less than 1 years old) because it's pre-existing... Our kitten was previously tested for ear mites (common parasite) and it was discovered he had a yeast infection. We treated him for that and it went away. Fast forward to now, where we have recently found out he has some sort of allergy. Because they did prior testing and treatment on his ears, COMPLETELY unrelated to his new illness, they are denying his open claims and all future claims related to allergies. They do not have a formal appeals department either - you write them a letter and email it to them. 

UPDATE: Spoke with a Supervisor 3/29 and she told me to not bother appealing my case because it will be denied. They will not do anything to help and they have gone out of their way to discourage me from fighting for my pet. All in all I am out of $2500 because I trusted this company.
title: HORRIFIC. Did everything right and it doesn't matter

text:
I spent awhile looking at different sources of coverage for our puppy. Friends with other sources of pet insurance reported negative experiences, so I was wary. Eventually, I settled on Spot Pet Insurance and I am SO grateful that I did!

For one, I think it’s amazing that your plan is customizable for you and your pets needs. Second, pretty soon after registering, I received a phone call from Spot Pet Insurance welcoming Rusty to the Spot family! It was such a nice touch, and I appreciated the personnel on the line asking if I had any questions or was confused on how to file a claim. 

Which brings me to how EASY it was to file my first claim for a simple wellness exam and vaccine appointment. I submitted the claim March 18th and was notified it had been processed and completed March 21st. So easy, and very user friendly! Everyone I’ve dealt with has been so helpful, kind, and efficient. 

I really appreciate the coverage and care for our boy, Rusty. Spot Pet Insurance was the best possible choice I could have made!
title: BEST pet insurance ever!!!

I sent you the itemized list. What more did you need, and why didn't you call me instead of just denying it. They said they reopened the claim, but wouldn't send me a confirmation email etc.

You guys are great!
title: Pleasant surprise!

text:
We're into our 4th year as Spot clients for our two Golden Retrievers.  We picked Spot for it coverage because they covered (at least at the time) issues specific to the Golden Retriever breed, hip/elbow dysplasia and cancer, without any wait period. While not the least expensive, you get what you pay for.  Once you understand that basic pet insurance will not cover the routine visits, but is meant for illness/accident coverage, you'll save yourself a lot of grief.  Spot has been great in paying what I felt was covered, and the process for filing a claim over the last few years has improved immensely.  It is done on-line, a few clicks, down load the invoice and submit.  You can track the status of your claim by logging-in to your account.
Been very happy with Spot, premiums went up over the lock down years, but most recent was considerable less than prior year, even with our dogs now 3 and 7 y/o, a very pleasant surprise!  Recommend Spot
title: We're into our 4th year as Spot clients…

text: Our new Golden Retriever puppy was delivered from our breeder in Missouri to our home in Arizona (a 19 hour drive). Not surprisingly, the trauma of a long drive, new home and a new diet resulted in diarrhea after 11 days. On day 13 we took him to our vet. While we were well aware of the 14 day, pre-existing condition clause, I never believed that normal diarrhea from a new pup would trigger that clause. Apparently it did. What that means is if my dog develops diarrhea again over the next 180 days, Spot will consider it a pre-existing condition. This is absurd. I canceled my insurance and suggest anyone with a pup to be extremely careful.

text:
We may as well have taken the money spent on our policy and given it away instead. Spot will look for any and all reasons to deny your claims, which is to be expected, most pet insurance is useless unless there is a horrible accident, but if Spot can't find a reason they will make it up. If you question their reasoning, their rude and condescending staff is more than happy to create a different excuse (or in the case of one person we had the displeasure of speaking with, just say "tough"). 
We're certainly learned our lesson with Spot (who also operates as ASPCA Insurance, be careful out there). 

Edit since there is no ability to reply to a reply: Even though the Spot representative who replied to this review claims that they are not related to ASPCA Pet Insurance, Spot is administered and their claims are adjudicated by PTZ Insurance Agency, Ltd., who is listed as the producers of ASCPA Pet Insurance. It's different desks in the same office.

text: Bad start to the relationship with SPOT. We got a 8 week old pure bred Great Dane puppy. We signed up for SPOT day 1 of bringing him home. Unfortunately, at his 11 week birthday de developed loose stools and diarrhea with a cough. this was concerning so we took him to the vet multiple times. I let the vet run whatever diagnostics they believed to be needed to sort him out and then submitted the claims to SPOT to go again our $1K deductible. Spot denied the claim, saying they needed his "ENTIRE CHART" (keep in mind, this is a brand new PUPPY! I had the vet directly email them the chart and CC me to make sure it was done. SPOT as continued to sit on the claim for weeks. They won't even need to pay out for this claim! this will only go against his deductible! We had Nationwide Pet insurance with our last dog and for 10 years we had zero problems and rapid claim processing! never once did Nationwide ask for a "Chart" from the vet, only the itemized invoice from the vet. I am stunned and repulsed by this experience and will be looking for alternative insurance for our puppy. This was NOT a good way to start our relationship SPOT!

text:
UPDATE (2/21/24): Spot Pet Insurance attempted to remove this review from Trustpilot since it was not 5 stars. I had to verify my account information three times in order for the review to stay (once should have been sufficient). It should be known that the reason this company has high reviews is that they remove low rating reviews!!!!! 

I called this company several time both prior to signing up and after to confirm coverage for my cat. I will also say that every single person I spoke with on the phone was extremely rude. They then denied my claim without any explanation. One of the symptoms my cat was seen for was preexisting but the other was treated before enrollment (which I confirmed would be covered and the customer service people lied to me). They need to provide an option to re-submit a claim for further review and provide written explanation on why claims are denied. I will be canceling my service ASAP. I am SO disappointed that I paid for a full year up front. Complete scam.

text: I called this company several time both prior to signing up and after to confirm coverage, as one of my dogs has a hereditary deformed leg. I was told multiple times that hereditary conditions are covered and that even if it is considered a pre existing condition (when the issue presented, he was examined, no treat given at time, just told that at some point it would likely cause him issues), the issue would be covered as long as the animal had not been seen within 6 months after the start of a policy. I signed up with this company 9 months ago. Now my dog is showing signs of discomfort due to his deformed leg. I called again, explaining everything, and was assured he was covered. I had him seen by his regular vet who referred me to a specialist. The specialist needed a CT Scan to determine the best course of treatment. I submitted my claims, calling each time (3 Claims in all) to confirm that the condition would be covered as it was hereditary and it has been 4 yrs since he was seen for this specific issue. All claims were declined. THIS IS A TERRIBLE COMPANY. They mislead me in every way possible and are obviously only interested in getting as much money as possible from people as they can before they wise up.
title: repeately gave out false information to get account

text: Last summer, I adopted an adult cat from a local SPCA. I signed him up for Spot Pet Insurance thinking I was being a smart cat guardian but the first several months were awful. Spot claimed that the vet was refusing to answer their calls but the vet's office denied that Spot had ever made contact. I began collecting the vet's medical notes myself and submitting them directly to Spot. Spot continued to deny all claims because they wanted several years of past medical history and documentation -- for a cat from the pound!  Not too many rescue pets come with medical history! If they don't cover shelter adoptees then they shouldn't be taking my premium payments. I was ready to cancel my policy and mentioned to them that I was going to submit a complaint to my state Insurance Commissioner.  Suddenly, they started paying my claims!  Since then, they have processed claims within a week and have paid for everything except for prescription food. I decided not to challenge them about the food because I was just so relieved to stop fighting with them. Not recommended for rescue pets because of the nonsense about requiring medical history. I now have another rescue cat and will use a different provider for her pet insurance.
title: Not Recommended for Shelter Adoptions

text:
I was initially excited about Spot Pet Insurance, hoping it would be the perfect solution for my pet’s healthcare needs. The idea of having a wellness policy that covers important vaccinations like Rabies and Lyme’s disease seemed ideal. However, my experience has been a mix of satisfaction and disappointment.

The main issue lies in the representation of the wellness policy’s coverage. Before purchasing, the policy details seemed to promise comprehensive coverage for various vaccines, including Rabies and Lyme’s disease. This was a major selling point for me. However, post-purchase, the reality was different. The policy specifies a maximum of $25 coverage, but only for one vaccine, not for each as I had assumed based on the pre-purchase information. This was misleading, especially since the website mentioned no such maximums initially, leading one to believe that each shot in a vaccine series would be reimbursed.

While I appreciate the coverage Spot does provide, the discrepancy between the pre-purchase promises and the actual policy terms is concerning. It feels like a significant oversight or, worse, an intentional misrepresentation. For a consumer who is not meticulously analyzing the fine print, this can be quite deceiving.

In conclusion, while I want to love Spot for its pet insurance offerings, the gap between expectation and reality in terms of policy coverage has dampened my enthusiasm. I believe clearer communication and transparency in policy details would greatly improve customer experience and satisfaction.
title: Mixed Feelings About Spot Pet Insurance - A Three-Star Review

text: My dog has the accidental illness and preventative care coverage.  She was recently spayed and she has had some serious complications.  She is apparently allergic to the sutures that were used for the procedure (both internal and internal).  Her incision opened and most of her other sutures came out.  She has required multiple doctor examinations, medications, light therapy, and antibiotics.  Thankfully, it has all been covered by Spot!  The claims process is amazingly easy - I just have to upload her invoice on the app and explain why I took her to the vet.  The claims return time is very quick.  After spending thousands of dollars at the vet I am so thankful when I see the claims report from Spot with my coverage and reimbursement amount.  Getting Spot was truly the best decision!  Member for life!!
title: Best decision ever!

text: So far I've been incredibly impressed with the level of service and the simplicity of SPOT pet insurance processes. I work in the technology field so I know the tendency to go with AI and automated service for as much of the process as possible to keep costs low. I was impressed that I was able to speak to an actual person very quickly when my questions were not included in the FAQ pages. We experienced a nearly fatal accident with our dog just a few days after the insurance went into effect. I'm waiting to see how the process goes forward. Knowing the amount of her care exceeds what I ever expected to pay for her veterinary services, I expect a certain amount of investigation by the SPOT team. But after that concludes I want to see if the service level changes.  Update to come.  Stay tuned...

text:
I was initially so excited about Spot after researching a bunch of pet insurance companies! I'd had pets nearly all my life but never had ventured into pet insurance before. I have an older GSD and a young, wild GSD pup so it felt like a good time. 
Nope. 
Going to be a one year purchase and then I'm out. 
The app and user experience is slick and easy, So that's not the issue. And the price wasn't outrageous for what I thought was decent coverage. Those are the two stars. 
All I can say is read every line of the small print and maybe show it to a lawyer. I DID read it carefully, and I'm alert and suspicious. But when my dog tore his CCL and required surgery, it was denied and I was shocked. Here's why: midway through the 5 or so pages of small print, there was a definition of animal anatomy (I'm paraphrasing from memory): bilateral body parts are considered as a single unit (meaning front legs are one unit, 2 kidneys (I suppose)... 2 pages later at the end, it said that preexisting conditions weren't covered. Of course! I thought to myself. So when my dog tore his CCL they saw from vet records that he'd torn his opposite knee 3 years before... cue the bilateral definition from mid-document. His rear legs were one so the knee surgery he'd had years before were considered prior conditions spread over to the previously healthy leg.  
Wow. I would not have put those two widely separated sections together. We were left high and dry with a useless accident and illness policy that didn't actually cover an accident.
The other thing is check what your vet charges for routine car against the reimbursement amounts Spot provides. I didn't do this, so my bad. 
I had the wellness policy I for my puppy. The reimbursements are adequate for maybe covering the cost of a low income spay neuter clinic sponsored by the humane society, but NO vet in private practice charges the modest fees that are anywhere close to the small amounts they charge for procedures and check-ups. 
I live in a rural area. My vet is not outrageous, but I am still left paying hundreds of dollars for spaying and dozens of dollars for vaccines and wellness checkups even after Spot kicks in its small reimbursements. 
Not a fan.
title: I was so excited about Spot…at first.

Spot is super simple and easy to use.

Its worth every penny and i will forever recommend them to anyone looking for pet insurance. My dog became sick suddenly and the reimbursements from each doctors visit was worth it in the end. Pet insurance is definitely something every pet parent should invest in, because in the long run (as your babies age) it saves you so much money and gives you some security.
Its easy to get a hold of someone if necessary, submitting a claim/documents is simple, especially using the app. The turn around of submitting the claim, it being reviewed and then getting my reimbursement is quick. I have absolutely no complaints about my service with them.

text: Spot was my first experience with having pet insurance.  As with any new relationship with a company I had questions about how easy and competent the processes would be if I needed to make a claim.  I signed my two dogs up and in less than a month one of them needed veterinary care for a foreign object lodged in her nasal cavity.  Two procedures a couple of weeks apart to resolve the issue.   The claim process was very easy and straight forward.  Review of the claim was done in a few days.  On the first claim I had the check mailed to me, which I have not yet received, but expect too soon.  The second claim made two weeks after the first I signed up for direct deposit and that payment was in the account a few days after the claim was approved.

text: I was skeptical about purchasing pet insurance because I saw the return on two of my claims was minimal.  Then my puppy found a baggie with my daily meds in it that I had forgotten about in the pocket of a pair of pants that were on the floor of the bathroom while I was taking a shower.  I came out of the bathroom and found a capsule that she had bitten through and the powder from inside was nearly gone.  After a trip and overnight to Emergency Vets, the bill was nearly $2000.  I filed the claim, and within ten days $1800 was deposited into my bank account.  Now I know why I have insurance!

text: Spot Pet Insurance came through when I needed them most. My precious dog passed away after a tragic and random toxin ingestion beyond my control. It feels like I’ve lost my child and I’m deeply devastated. When I hospitalized him, I immediately reread my coverage plan in a panic. I work in the entertainment industry in Los Angeles and our industry has been on a double strike for over four months which has put me in a compromising position financially that I wouldn’t normally be in. If it weren’t for having Spot, I would not have been able to try everything I could to save him and would have never forgiven myself. My dog received the best possible care and though my efforts were a loss, I can rest in knowing I tried my best and did not have to suffer absolute financial ruin for doing so. I am so thankful to Spot and couldn’t recommend their coverage enough. They made it as seamless as possible and I was reimbursed within a week of the accident. I hope anyone reading this does not ever, ever have to utilize it for the same reasons, but it is absolutely worth paying into the largest policy you can. Even after reimbursement and cancelling my policy, a Spot staff member even called to send condolences, and ask if there was anything I needed. For a (now) non-paying customer, that felt so kind and was one more step further in good customer service. I am so thankful that Pet insurance like theirs exists. Thank you with all my heart!
title: Spot Pet Insurance is the Best

text:
I’ve never had insurance for a pet before but I have however had over $10,000 in medical bills from one cat.  When I saw Spot Pet Insurance I figured I’d give it a shot.  I had recently lost a few rescues from FIV and just that alone was more than the annual cost of Spot.  

After I tested, I insured and I was glad I did.  A rambunctious cat fight caused an abscess and that treatment alone met my deductible.  Here I am a few months later at the ER vet and it’s not as stressful knowing he has insurance and I can focus on him and his care, not where I’m going to come up with the money for him.  

Because of this insurance my cats are better off and I’m not as stressed.  Besides they are more important than a few Starbucks each month

text: I've been using Spot for over one year. At the time I signed up, I only had one dog who was 12 years old. I had shopped around and gotten quotes from other insurance companies, but because of her age and the limitations on building a flexible plan, they were all outrageously expensive. Then I found Spot and it offers more options for building a custom plan, so I could get the price down to a reasonable monthly amount while still having good coverage and a high reimbursement percentage. I had no problems during the first year and none of her claims were turned down. I adopted a second dog in the spring of 2023 and added her to my plan. Because I was adding a second dog and because she was only 2, her rate was much cheaper! I was able to increase her plan and still have the rate be below $60 per month! I renewed my plan a couple months ago and increased my senior dogs plan a bit, and still between the two of them it's less than $200 per month with great coverage and a high reimbursement percentage. I still have had no issues with claims and nothing has been denied. My senior dog has been having some health issues and has needed to expensive things done like an EKG of her heart and it was covered no problem. I'm very happy with Spot so far and I can see why it's ranked the best pet insurance company of 2023 by Forbes and many others.
title: Best pet insurance company of 2023

text: I insured 3 cats: 1, 2, and 18 years old. My 18 year old recently passed away. When I submitted my claim for end of life care, Spot Insurance sent me a condolence email and a few days later someone called me with condolences. I was touched by this. Without request, they ended my deceased cat’s insurance the day after he died, refunded the remaining monthly insurance fee, and reimbursed me for my cats end of life vet bill. I am totally impressed with this company. I am glad my two younger cats are covered by such a caring company.
title: A Company that Cares

text: Horrible company. My cat passed away earlier this week and luckily I was able to pay all of the costs but they denied every claim and their reason was “your claim wasn’t eligible for coverage” but I purchased the accident and illness coverage. We took him to the ER because he had 2 mini episodes of what looked like seizures back to back and we weren’t going to risk it progressing into anything else. My cat was diagnosed with HCM and never in his short life showed ANY symptoms of that condition. Unfortunately that is why it’s known as the “silent killer”. Also, no emails explaining in depth why it was denied. Not a pre-existing condition and was never seen for anything related to this. If I can’t trust you guys during this time, what makes you think I’d trust this rotten company with my other pets. The fake reviews are also such a red flag. Please, all pet parents, go ANYWHERE else but this company. I also called the company that handles the underwriting for them and their representative told me multiple times they had no record whatsoever on the claim that was supposedly sent by Spot.
title: GO ANYWHERE ELSE

STAY THE HELL AWAY FROM THIS FRAUDULENT COMPANY! I used to have Embrace and what a mistake it was to leave!

text:
We signed up for this coverage when our puppy was 8 weeks old. Given this, any claim for illness/injury would have happened within his coverage period. 

He is now 9 months old and we have submitted three claims. Each time, the company asks for records from every vet he’s ever seen to make sure it’s not pre-existing. 

With the last claim, they requested records from the wrong vet. I responded in their app and by email three times. I finally had to call to get this corrected. 

That said, the claim submission process is very simple and user friendly. Hence the three stars instead of two.

title: First time I have been unhappy with my…

text:
There’s so many insurance companies - GO elsewhere. 

I made the mistake of choosing Spot insurance. My first mistake was my dad who has been a veterinarian for 30+ years had never heard of it. He then gave me a list of other reputable companies to trust. 

Unfortunately I chose to go with Spot as they had sponsored ads and a low premium. I also made the mistake of thinking I probably would not need it. 

I signed up and after the waiting period I ended up having to take out kitten to the emergency room as her body had an allergic reaction and become entirely inflamed and covered in open wounds. 

I was referred to a specialist in which we are still in the process of diagnosing the exact concern. 

Spot immediately declined all claims stating this is pre existing as prior to the full body reaction her spay incision had become infected and they are saying because of that they will not cover her claims for any of her issues. 

I am currently in the appeal process and will update this review as we get more answers from spot, however, as of now I am extremely dissatisfied and would warn anyone of signing up with them.
title: GO ELSEWHERE - falsely labeling issues as pre existing

text: I have the $250 annual deductible, 80% reimbursement, $3000 limit plan for my two indoor cats. One has never needed to go to the vet for anything other than her yearly check-up. The other has had a myriad of accidents from eating string, to vomiting blood for absolutely no reason (we found out he was just sick and must have vomited repeatedly while we were away at work) and every time, Spot insurance has been there to help reimburse our very expensive kitty’s medical bills. This is a huge relief for us because you just never know when that little rascal is going to have another strange accident! I highly recommend Spot insurance because they work quickly to process claims, they contact you via email when they need additional info and have reimbursed the majority of my kitty’s  vet bills. I really couldn’t be happier with their service.
title: Best thing I ever did for my cat

text: I’m on my 4th shitzhu and I’ve only needed pet insurance for “last illness”, but Chloe has been a different story.  Within her first 6 months she poked her eye in something and it became infected and ulcerated…. First we ran to the vet but after they looked at her they sent us to the Animal Eye Clinic .  She needed surgery, multiple meds every day and lots of follow up visits.  When it looked as if the eye was saved, as well as her sight, we slipped her in to the vet to be spayed.  Then, she scratched her other eye!  Back to Animal Eye… this time no surgery but many meds daily and many follow up check ups.  We came in close to the $10,000 annual limit ( a little over $8,000) .  SPOT paid on each individual claim, less our deductible and then 80% of the balance.  Their online portal is even easy enough for me to navigate without help from children or grandchildren!  They paid each claim promptly.  It’s nice to know I have a financial partner to help keep my Chloe well.
title: I love never having to hesitate taking my dog to the vet

We purchased only the accident / illness policies, not the wellness and also opted for higher deductibles to keep down the cost of the policies. The younger puppy has needed a few surgeries related to his eyes that was unforeseen; however, the surgeries helped alleviate the problems and the insurance greatly enhanced our ability to afford the procedures. The app and the claims process were very easy to use. I highly recommend taking a look at Spot if you don't have insurance for your pet.

text: For the most part, I really love this insurance. Last year one of my babies developed epilepsy and it helped tremendously. This year, the same one ate something he shouldn’t have and had to have it surgically removed. The vet bill was nearly $12k after three days of figuring out what was wrong and having the emergency surgery. It completely wiped out his insurance funds until next July. I pray everyday that nothing else happens to him before his insurance rolls over to a new year. I pay the highest premium for preventative care, the most amount of coverage, the highest return percentage, and the smallest deductible. The highest amount of insurance caps at $7k and that truly could be wiped out by one emergency like this one and then leave him not covered for the next 10 months.
title: Love it for the most part

text:
My sweet German Shepherd, my sweet baby boy of 8 y.o.,  was found to have Cardiac hemangiosarcoma- a large mass in his right atrium that was bleeding.  They drained the blood from his heart and needed to stay the night in the ICU.  He stabilized and he was able to be discharged.  He had multiple ultrasounds the weeks following to monitor a rebleed.  He ultimately did rebleed, the large amount of blood was drained for comfort and so that we could euthanize him at home.  
Spot insurance has been very quick with reimbursements and thoughtful.  They reimbursed the euthanasia and cancelled his policy without me having to give them a call.  As one can imagine, this has been a very difficult time for our pack and not having to hassle with insurance has been appreciated.
title: My sweet German Shepherd

text: In March of this year, my cat had a sudden medical disaster. The cost of the 1-week hospitalization, which included emergency abdominal surgery and a multi-day ICU stay, exceeded $43,000 (this is not a typo). Spot was great and promptly reimbursed me once I submitted all the documentation. They've also since paid for ongoing vet bills (the most recent for a routine outpatient visit with sonogram was slightly more than $1,000). My cat was reasonably healthy when I bought pet insurance for her. You never expect a medical calamity so my advice now to anyone with a pet is to get insurance ASAP. Just like people, every pet is going to eventually need thousands of dollars of veterinary care.
title: Excellent insurance worth every penny

I have direct deposit set up so reimbursements are sent as soon as as claims are completed. Overall...I am very satisfied with Spot and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to anyone looking to get pet insurance 👍

If your human child has health insurance, your four legged child should as well. We would have been in so much debt if not for Spot Pet I surance.
The app is so easy to understand. Filing claims is easy peasy. I suggest you download your pet's medical history. Be thorough when describing your claim. Spot reimburses quickly and will direct deposit if you would like.

text: The matter of most importance is whether an insurance group will make good on "their" end of the agreement. In my experience, SPOT Pet Insurance has done so without reservations or difficulty. This past year was medically challenging for one of my dogs. He required specialized medical attention and therapy. I can say without any reservation that SPOT honored ALL of its contractual agreements, provided reimbursement funds in a timely matter, and its recordation of the aforementioned was easily available and timely. This was the first time I truly needed SPOT to come through for me ... it did ... and it cemented (again) why I personally believe pet insurance is crucial. Having SPOT has permitted me to make difficult decisions based upon medical objectives and veterinary care without feeling the constraints that financial concerns are the primary basis for a decision or prevention of needed medical care. Thank you, SPOT, for keeping your end of the agreement.
title: SPOT lived up to its end of the agreement when it was most needed!

text:
UPDATE: After the response from SPOT I would like to add that every follow-up from SPOT I was given a different reason for denial.  I stand by my fact-based review that SPOT is a fraudulent company and will purposely deny claims.  

SPOT insurance is a fraudulent company that refuses to cover vet bills.  My dog was seen for an ear infections related to wet ears.  SPOT denied the claim because my dog had previously been seen at an emergency vet when she rolled in grass and had foxtails embedded in her ears.  SPOT stated that my pet had a pre-existing condition of ear infections which is untrue because foxtail removal from ears is NOT related to allergies or infections.  Spot then claims that my dog was diagnosed with allergies and allergies are a non-curable condition therefore SPOT will not cover any visit or prescription related to allergies.  SPOT then continues to state that my dog's ear infection is related to allergies.  My dog was NEVER diagnosed with allergies or seen by a vet for allergies until the visit when I submitted a claim.  For each claim and each appeal I have filed I have been given a different excuse as to why my claim was denied.  I was a customer for a few months which is why I believe my claim was denied because SPOT would not have received enough money in premiums to cover the cost of the claim reimbursement.  If the excuses for denial were consistent I would be more likely to believe that SPOT was not a fraudulent company, however they know what to say and how to manipulate medical records to deny payment for a claim.
title: SPOT insurance is a fraudulent company…

text:
UPDATE: After leaving this review I received a call telling me how to appeal a claim which I will be doing. On another note my cat recently got Urinary crystals and had to goto a few emergency vet visits. He had this problem a few years ago and was cured of it and in remission for over a year now. I’m so relieved and grateful that spot stayed true to their policy and did not consider this a pre-existing condition. At this moment I feel the pros outweigh the cons and say I think they are worth giving a chance. 

—————————————————

I think this insurance is useless if you have an older pet. They should be more clear and upfront about that before people spend the money they need to pay their vet bills on this insurance. I got my cats dental cleaning done. I called Spot before time and asked if they covered this if my cat has dental disease. I was told yes - if the cleaning is for dental disease they will. I get the cleaning done and I wait a really long time to get my claim done. They reimburse me nothing. I call and ask why and I’m told that it’s a Pre-existing condition. I’m very confused now because this is the first time I’ve ever been told to clean my cats teeth. The lady on the phone sounds slightly judgmental and tells me stage 3 dental disease is incurable so it’s not covered. I called two more times. The last person I talked to was nicer, I asked if she can look through my cats medical records and tell me why it’s a pre-existing condition. It took her a really long time to look that she almost had to contact the claims adjusters. Finally she says in 2018 there is a note that says he has a little bit of tartar on his teeth. Literally all cats over the age of 1 years old have tartar. I wrote a strongly worded email to my vet asking why no one told me to get my cats teeth cleaned before. A few days ago my cat started having a medical emergency. I saw my vet and we talked about it and he tells me that stage 3 dental disease is curable and the cleaning is what cures it. He also thinks the insurance just is doing anything it can to not pay me. I’ve been out of work for 3 months and still paying for this insurance to make sure I can take care of my fur babies but I honestly think it’s hurting me more. I was so overwhelmed at the vet I started crying and my vet even covered a bit of my bill for me - more this insurance has done. I really wish I saved the money I used on this insurance because my cat is not doing well and the vet bills are pilling up. I’m worried they will not help me with any of these bills and by the time I find out I’ll have already wasted more money on them..
title: Pros and Cons

text:
I took out a policy on my dog 3 months ago. I got the accident illness coverage with a 500.00 deductible, and also the gold coverage that covers wellness exams and other things like vaccines. It's barely worth it, but I figured even using one wellness exam I'd get 50.00 back. Even though my dog had just been to the rescue vet 3 months earlier, I took him in for a wellness check. He's a young dog in good health, so my only main reason is because I could do it with no deductible. During the visit the vet noticed a sore in the corner of the dog's mouth. He said he'd put the dog on an antibiotic for a couple of weeks to clear it up. The bill said "Office Visit" and "Doxycycaline" Then Spot asked for medical records and vet notes. So because the antibiotic was prescribed, they said it wasn't a wellness exam. I argued with 5 different people in one day to no avail. So now that Gold rider I purchased is worthless because my dog has had everything on the list of things they pay a little money on. I asked if I could get my money back on the gold rider, and they said yes, for the time I hadn't used it. I hadn't used it at all! They refused to pay me for the wellness exam so nothing on the policy had been used. I decided to just keep the policy for now because it will just be a loss for me, but I plan to cancel when the first year is up. Talking to these people is like talking to a brick wall and they are just there to steal your money.

UPDATE: The company gives these friendly replies to make it look like they actually did something to resolve the issue. They did not and nothing has changed.
title: Rip Off Company

text:
EDIT 8/18/23 I received a call from Spot Customer Service yesterday regarding my review here. I didn't think to write down her name, but she was very courteous and seemed genuinely concerned. She apologized for the person who hung up on me on my previous call and said that the problem had been addressed. She explained that the delay in getting Dudley's vet records on the latest claim was in getting them updated from the ones they'd received previously, which sounded reasonable. 
I am upgrading my rating from 1 to 4 stars. While none of my expenses have been covered as yet, they have replied to my reviews here in a manner that allays at least most, if not all, of my concerns. I will continue using them as my insurer. 

EDIT 8/8/23 I called Spot after they replied here, suggesting I do so. I reiterated my complaints as described below. On the issue of not paying for his vaccinations, they explained that I hadn't paid for preventative care when I purchased the insurance. Fair enough, I'd forgotten that.
On the issue of delaying a decision on my claim for his vaccinations for weeks, claiming they didn't have his records, even though they'd denied two previous claims based on his records, at first he didn't reply. When I repeated the question, HE HUNG UP ON ME! Guess who's going shopping!

Original Post, circa Aug 1:
I subscribed to Spot for insurance on my 11 yr old dachshund a few months ago. So far I've submitted 3 claims totally over $1300 and not a dime of it has been accepted. I'm beginning to think that any ailment he may have is automatically considered a pre-existing condition. This includes his vaccinations which I thought would be covered under preventative medicine (which is specifically named in the policy and on the selection list when you file a claim) though they denied that too. I'm sure that somewhere in the fine print, probably on page 47, that vaccinations, along with everything else that might actually happen, is excluded. The decision on this payment took weeks because they needed his records which they claimed not to have even though both previous claims were denied as existing conditions months earlier. So how did they know they were pre-existing conditions if they didn't yet have his records? I smell a rat!
title: I subscribed to Spot for insurance on…Jan 17, 2023

text: I had a policy for each of my cats. Per the contract, pre-existing conditions are not covered. However, they have a 180-day period where if a condition doesn't occur, it is not considered pre-existing. This stood out to me as a positive since pretty much no insurance company allows pre-existing conditions (this is a huge fail with health insurance, pet or human, but that's another conversation). One of my cats needed emergency surgery to remove an eye, and after I submitted the almost $2,000 claim, I found it was rejected/not covered due to it being a pre-existing condition for something that had occurred 220 days prior. One, THIS wasn't related to the other vet visit, at all -- this was an emergency. Two, it was well over the 180-day grace period even if they could try their hardest to related the two. The rep told me that since it was noted on his vet records, it IS considered pre-existing (but it was unrelated??) and it will NOT be covered. What is the point of pet insurance if they don't cover emergency surgeries which are always expensive? And what is the point of sticking with a policy/company if they don't uphold their word?
title: Immediately canceled my policy after this

text: So disappointed with this company. We read all of the reviews, compared other plans. We were with Nationwide for years, but we’re hoping to get better coverage. They do a great sales pitch. However, when our 1 yr old dog had a yeast infection on his ears due to an allergic reaction from a shampoo, he scratched his body and outside of ears because they were itchy. He then got an atopic infection on outside of ears. It was difficult to resolve as they weren’t sure if it was bacterial or fungus. It took a few visits to get it under control, but it was complete resolved. Spot denied a claim for the last visit to his vet, in which they took cultures and administered both antibiotics and fungus meds. It came to almost $700 because we needed to get this resolved once and for all. The culture from the lab came back that it was indeed yeast. They denied the claim claiming it was a pre-existing condition and also said they would not cover any type of dermatitis he ever got in the future. I appealed with notes from the vet that it was resolved. They said that it seemed he had chronic allergies and they won’t cover it! Dogs get yeast infections. Dogs have allergic reactions. But they considered it a permanent chronic condition! We went back to Nationwide.
title: So disappointed with this company

text:
As of now, I can only give a review on the pricing of my pet's insurance plan. I was able to pick coverage plan, unlimited yearly amount, deductible ($100/year), and reimbursement amount (90%), for a total cost of $122/month. I spent time shopping around and what I liked most about Spot was the options that I could pick. Other insurance companies didn't come CLOSE. My fur baby just turned one in April and since she has no pre-existing conditions, I feel that this is the best policy for her life span.
The other rating that I can give for now, is how easy it was to sign her up on their website and how easy the website is to use. I have limited technical knowledge so this too was a bonus.
I will gladly post another review when I admit any bills in the future.

text:
So far so good. Enrollment was easy.

On iPhone uploading a picture via safari didn’t work but I had no issues doing it on the app.

I was also able to add names of people who could make changes to our policy (like my husband) but have not been able to send them access to the account online, having that fixed would be really nice.

We haven’t needed to process any claims yet. The policy doesn’t go into effect until 15 days after enrollment so we signed up early. Our puppies won’t be home until the end of the month- the policy should go into effect right around the time our puppies come home to us.

I feel I can’t give a fair review until we have actually don’t anything to use the policy we purchased.

text:
My dog has Spot Pet Insurance. I keep very good care of my dog. She had been diagnosed for head allergy in July 2018. The latest allergy related visit was in September 2020. I took her to vet for a paw issue in January 2023. The vet assumed it was allergy (vets are not very good at diagnosing in the first place, he was suggesting all kinds of things....). This is full 3 years+ after the previous allergy visit (on the forehead). Spot Pet Insurance denied my claim for this sick visit, as it is pre-existing cause. Excuse me? How is it pre-existing? I have kept my dog healthy for three plus years. I am flabbergasted how poorly this pet insurance covers anything. It certainly denies all the sick visit claims. Useless insurance to pay for! DO NOT GET SPOT PET INSURANCE!

Addition on 3/6/2023 after reading Spot Pet Insurance's response to mine:
This system does not allow me to post below the BS response from Spot Pet Insurance. They are pretty much a scam. The response makes the reader think that they actually will do something about the issue. THEY WON'T! I wrote my review after speaking to their rep on that phone number their posting lists below. HORRIBLE INSURANCE! I DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE TO GET SPOT INSURANCE. THEIR RESPONSE TO THIS REVIEW SHOWS THEIR IGNORANCE AND TRYING TO LOOK GOOD FOR OTHER POTENTIAL CUSTOMERS. THEY WILL DO NOTHING EVEN IF I CALLED THE NUMBER. IT IS ALL DAMAGE CONTROL FROM THIS BS PET INSURANCE COMPANY. DO NOT GET SPOT PET INSURANCE! SCAM!
title: Spot Pet Insurance denies legitimate sick claims!

text: Pet parents, please don't waste your time with the company. We have already had so much to deal with. I am not sure why SPOT has good reviews when my experience was totally opposite. I am a retired nurse, and this is an honest opinion. Took my dog in to the urgent care, because she coughed blooded 2 days earlier. The vet asked me when did I started seeing my dog cough. I told the vet that it could be a couple of months ago due to the Wildfire but that was very minor. Or it could have been the virus from the groomer (being close to other dogs). I wasn't sure. However, this was a loud cough with blood, that has never happened before. The vet couldn't find anything wrong with her. Cough suppressant was prescribed. Found out my family and I had Covid. The illness was considered pre-existing condition because I told the vet that the cough might start from wildfire a couple of month ago. I wrote on the claim that my family had COVID and ready to show proves. They assume that both coughs are related eventhough the professional didn't have the answer. The vet didn't test my dog for COVID as we didn't know we had COVID. The first incident or symptom (pre-existing) should be coughing blood not coughing. This is unprofessional and unethical.
title: Unprofessional and unethical

text:
All insurance policies are just leveraged risk between all the people who sign up and the company that pockets their money.

Every monthly premium goes into the company's pockets with only a small fraction being paid out to people who actually need it.

This applies to pets, cars, homes, people, and everything. I previously produced insurance and I can tell you first hand, it truly is all a waste of money.

So is working for a company for the rest of your life.
Break free from the matrix. Free your mind.
title: Insurance in general is a sham

This was a conversation not a scripted survey and he understood our pet insurance needs. I am new to Spot and feel better about choosing this company as part of our pet care team.
title: Genuine Customer Service Call

text:
Spot was highly recommended to me by several acquaintances.  As a result, I signed up online on Dec 25th for Spot for our 10 mos. old cavachon who is still at the trainer's facility and will be delivered to us Jan 2.  I received a call from Spot a few days later (on Dec 29th) ostensively inquiring about whether we knew how the insurance worked and how to file claims and if we had any questions.  In the course of the conversation, I mentioned that our dog would be delivered on Jan 2nd by the trainer.  The representative harped on the point that the dog was not yet in our full possession and insisted we were not covered since the dog was not yet in our possession.  I explained that the dog is fully owned and paid for by us and I tried to explain this to her, but it made no difference.  She insisted that we had to reset the starting date to Jan 2nd and extend out the waiting period.  The dog is healthy and again recently vet checked and offered to provide her a copy of the vet report. I told her all this, but it made no difference.  

This seemed like a deceptive practice to me as it was not disclosed on the Spot website and the representative from Spot was insistent and not willing to escalate the matter to a higher level.  This made me think that Spot might handle claims if I had any in a similar and deceptive matter to avoid payment.  Had this issue on physical possession of the dog been clearly disclosed on the Spot website, I would have made the initial starting date later.

As a result, I canceled our insurance with Spot and went with another provider.  The cancellation was within the 30 day period and therefore I received a full refund.
title: Deceptive Practice to be aware of

text: We have owned many pets over the years and only (earlier) this year decided to add pet insurance for our Doberman, Madison.  Madison just turned 3 years old last week.  We received a terrible diagnosis last month for Madison (Wobblers) that has not only been emotionally difficult, but expensive to treat as well.  If we did not have this insurance, we would have had to have made other choices for Madison that would not have her here with us today.  Spot has been SO GOOD in handling our claims - they have been efficient, communication on the processing of the claims very thorough, and very quick considering the complexity of this diagnosis.  We are forever grateful for what Spot has given to us, which is to continue enjoying our very loved fur-baby.  I will never consider any other pet insurance for my pets; Spot has gained a forever customer!
title: The Absolute Best Experience in the Hardest of Times ...

text:
I am new to spot insurance. I have owned pets my whole life ( I am 70 YO). I treat my pets as my family, and over the years I usually spend between $1400.00 to $3500.00 per year on pet care, wellness visits, preventitive care, surgeries, shots, as well as food and supplies.
Being retired now, I wanted some financial help. after 2 months of reading reviews and visiting web sites I chose "SPOT" insurance because for me the company offered what I wanted for what I feel is a reasonable price. I just rescued a 3 YO german shepard and want the best for her, The website was easy to navigate, the contract I designed personally for me, and the couple of questions I had were answered politely and professionally by the insurance agent.   ...so far so good... Noel B

text: This company is a scam who takes your money and then we need them to cover something big, then they cry it’s a preexisting condition. My cat puked in January, and in the obstruction X-ray the vet noticed what could have been small kidneys, which could signify future chronic  kidney disease. We just had his blood drawn 10/31, he has to be put under, to double check if this is an issue, it isn’t, and Spot denied the claim. Stating clause 51, which I assume is preexisting condition. They’re employee who I spoke to in February told me that Spot would cover this test, but now $400 later, they won’t. I immediately changed to Lemonade insurance and am canceling Spot tomorrow. They also posted the same reply on this as they do everyone. I don’t need an explanation of what your 21 year old employee decided based on how it will benefit Spot. I need Spot to realize that a possible obstruction (which there wasn’t anything, suggesting my cat simply ate something that affected him adversely) resulting in an X-ray with a possible smaller kidney (turns out his kidneys are fine, based on the test your employee told me would be paid), is not the same thing. Cat eats something and pukes on one occasion ever in his life is not the same thing as cat could have chronic kidney disease, based on an incidental X-ray to see if cat has a ball of yarn in his stomach. Obviously whomever does the claims has no clue about the anatomy of animals. This is Spot taking care of Spot and not taking care of the customer or their beloved pet. I’ve now spent $1600 out of pocket this year and my cat is in perfect health, no thanks to Spot. I will never trust a Forbes suggestion ever again.
title: Spot is a Scam

text: I recently signed up for insurance for my emotional support dog that was in a hit and run car accident. The ad I saw for spot pet insurance said that the insurance was same day insurance, but when I finished signing up I read that I was going to have to wait 2 weeks to put in my first claim. I am not satisfied at all, I'm incredibly disappointed. This is not what was advertised when I was signing up. I am no longer interested in using this insurance company for my support dog.
title: Ad Lied

text: Before signing up with SPOT, I had done a lot of research of pet insurances and decided on SPOT because of the philosophy that they want pet insurance to become more mainstream to help reduce pet euthanasia due to owners being unable to afford vet bills.  They also seemed to have quite comprehensive coverage, including some common issues with the particular breed of dogs that I own.  This is my second year with SPOT and I have been very pleased with the coverage they have provided for both my boxer puppies.  Unfortunately these two dogs happen to have multiple issues and are frequent flyers at my vet's office; one even needs prescription dog food.  Having SPOT insurance has been a lifesaver to our bank account!  It is easy to file claims online and reimbursements are direct deposited into my account.  When I did have issues online or any questions, SPOT representatives have been very pleasant and helpful.  I would highly recommend to any pet owner!

text: I looked into pet insurance after having two old dogs get a bunch of chronic old dog issues at the same time and learned how expensive that is without insurance. I have had Spot Insurance for a little over a year. currently covering two dogs and 4 cats. I liked the flexibility of choosing preventative and accident/illness and setting my deductible, percentage reimbursed and max yearly payout. The turn around time on reimbursements is fast. Usually just a few days. Only once did a claim take longer, only because they checked on something with my vet.   The only thing that could be better is  covering more than $20 on blood work under the preventative care. Not so important for young pets, but for senior pets that get a senior wellness panel (cbc, serum biochemistry, thyroid) to catch any issues early, $20 doesn’t even cover much of one test.

text: Horrible pet insurance!!! You have been warned! You will never see single dollar. We put a claim on for our Puppies foot.  He had a small lesion on the top of his foot from licking it.  Our puppy had never been into the Vet for this issue or anything  like it.  We sent in our claim and got a letter back saying we had been denied.  We called the company and they said that it would take months to look into the issue. Meanwhile they were taking our $40.00 per month. Months went by and still nothing. Finally cancelled the insurance. What a complete scam! They need to be sued for what they are doing to people. How is this even legal?
title: Horrible pet insurance!!

Also, I know this piece is not as important as the insurance but if you pay for the entire year which we did in October, you were supposed to get a 25.00 Amazon gift card which I never did.I called to find out who I would contact about this and was given an email which took me right back to signing up for insurance. We will not be renewing for the next year. Very disappointing.

I am so glad i canceled spot and now use a different insurance that ended up providing more coverage for about the same money.  I don't like sneaky.

text: The signup process is straightforward, the rates are competitive, and the general operation of the website, from direct deposit setup to claim submission, is user-friendly. However, this is where the positives end. They've denied coverage on an emergency visit for a six-month old puppy with food poisoning claiming "prior condition," although they had the dog's prior history that clearly showed no prior stomach problems except a kennel-acquired intestinal worm that was cured with medication by the time the dog was three months old. Claim dispute process requires obtaining a case number by phone – and that's when problems begin, because Spot CANNOT BE REACHED BY PHONE. I've called three times and spent, respectively, 30, 35, and 45 minutes on hold, giving up eventually. I'm not going to give my business to a company that cannot provide proper access to all aspects of its operation.
title: Dispute Resolution Process Is a Nightmare

text:
If I could give it zero stars I would have.  I rescued a poodle three months ago and brought to a vet the next day.  He did a basic exam and said she needed some teeth removed and he wanted to test a flap of skin so we booked an appointment for a later date and I bought the spot $4000 pet insurance. She had not been diagnosed with anything at this point.  $2500 later she had 17 teeth removed and I turned in the paperwork.  Weeks and weeks and weeks went by.  The results came back from the flap and it was cancer.  Today I was informed that my initial claim was completed.  Denied due to pre existing condition.  So is the cancer surgery.  What a scam this is.  I am reporting to BBB.
Pet owners beware!
title: If I could give it zero stars I would…

text:
Stay away from this insurance!!!! I have an 8 month old puppy I rescued from a back yard Tied to a trampoline with no water in the Florida Sun. He was emaciated, and crying. I brought him home, fed and bathed him, then signed him up with Spot for pet insurance on October 21. I signed him up for accident/illness coverage, and was told there was a 10 day waiting period for the company's protection against pre-existing conditions. I called my vet and tried to schedule for an appointment, and the earliest one I could get was for November 9th, so I scheduled it, figuring I had the waiting period to get through. Around Halloween, I noticed that he was squinting his right, and that is was a little red, a couple days later, he stated scratching constantly at his right ear. I bought dog wipes, and cleaned out both ears. He was fine for a couple days, before I noticed he was starting with diarrhea. I called the vet's office, and they told me to give him boiled chicken and white rice because he was emaciated. November 9th I took him for his visit. He had an eye infection, an ear infection, and hookworm. They cleaned ans packed his ears, gave him a shot for hookworm, and treated his eye. They also gave him his puppy vaccinations. I was prescribed medication for all three illnesses and we were sent home with a two week follow up scheduled on November 22nd. The next morning, I filed the claim, and gave a brief description of what was going on. The vet bill was $465, $159 of that was for his vaccinations, which I knew was not covered under his plan. The claim took 3 weeks to process, and Spot blamed it on the vet, saying they never sent the info over to them. my vet showed me proof that they sent it over twice. The claim was finally processed, and 3 of the 4 categories listed were under accident/Illness, which left a total of $306 dollars which was not reimbersed. I called Spot to inquire about this, and they told me that the illness started before the waiting period was over. I told them I waited 19 days to take him to the vet. I am not a vet, and I could not diagnose him if there was an illness! That's why i took him to the vet!!!! they told me the illness occurred before the end of the waiting period, therefore, it was not covered because it was considered a pre-existing condition! Really. I paid my premium, went through the waiting period, and my dog got sick before his vet appointment, and it's a pre-existing condition???? They use technicalities to the limit!!! I am not a vet!!! I should have lied in the box where they asked what was going on. They lied, why cant I?   Spot feeds you the line that they are all about pet awareness, then they pull this??? THEY ARE LIARS, AND THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF!!!! Do not rescue a dog with this insurance!!!! If you do, lie about everything, or you won't be covered!!!! I am cancelling this policy and going with a different pet insurance. I know his second claim for his follow up, which is still in processing after a week, will be denied. Do your homework before buying pet insurance!!! My health plan doesn't pull this crap when I file a claim!!! Ive gone to my local news station, and they are doing an investigation on Spot, and their reimbursement policies! Stay tuned...

Update: they are very so sorry for my bad experience, and that is never easy to reject a claim. I should call the customer service number, and they will explain why my claim was denied. DON’T GET THIS INSURANCE!!!! I called the customer, and they explained their decision, and I repeat what I said before. THEY ARE LIARS AND THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF!!! Do not expected to be reimbursed for your claim! They will give you every excuse as for why they denied your claim!!!  Nothing has Changed!!! I am going to go with Pumpkin Pet insurance. They really care about both you and your pet! They promote pet wellness. Spot will just take your money, lie to you, and screw you!!! My local Fox Television station had been contacted, and they will be doing an investigation followed by a news story about Spot and other companies lack of transparency! Stay tuned. This is not over!
title: Stay away from this insurance!!!

Ingesting foreign object is included for the accident insurance that they offer but if your dog got gastroenteritis as a result of ingesting foreign object then it's not covered! Funny how they can get away with it and play you with the policies they have. Oh well, time to find another insurance...

text: I signed up and paid for a new Spot only coverage for a puppy.  Then I received 15 marketing emails telling me to get coverage for all of their available plans including Wellness coverage.  In each of the emails, a $25 Amazon gift certificate was mentioned for each new subscriber.  Since I had signed up online, I was eligible for the $25 gift certificate.  After consideration, I called Spot’s customer service to add the Wellness coverage since I read the marketing emails that were sent daily and I thought it made sense to add this coverage.  I was told by the agent that I was not allowed to add this coverage to my original policy and that she had to cancel it and start all over.  I agreed since she was going to add the Wellness only policy first which took effect the next day, and then add the Spot coverage which was delayed another two weeks before taking effect.  I then asked if I was still qualified for the $25 Amazon certificate and was told No since you had to buy the two plans online at the same time!  By the way, you couldn’t add the Wellness plan online after the fact and had to call it in.  So I ended up canceling everything and going elsewhere for coverage.
title: I signed up and paid for a new Spot…and added Wellness coverage but was declined for a gift card.

text: I ended up paying about $2200 for dental extraction and cleaning for my older dog.  After paying about $1200 in premiums I will only receive $150 back.  That means that I ended up paying $3400 in total for the vet bill and pet insurance and will receive only $150 back. What I have found out after doing extensive research on pet insurance, is that its not worth it. Many insurances don't cover lab fees, x-rays or medications so when you end up paying a large bill you think you are going to get 80% back. That's not the case, make sure to look at what the insurance covers and their policy on preexisting condition.  They will find any excuse to not cover majority of the cost, but what can you do? You already have to pay the full cost up front! and then you have to wait and see if some of it will be reimbursed??  If I had done better research I would have started a savings account where I could have put the same amount as the monthly premium into that account and made sure to have a credit card that I could use to cover the cost.  I ended up paying an extra $1100 when I could have saved that money to pay towards my dog's dental procedure!  They made an almost 100% profit. Pet insurance is definitely a scam.  Much worse than having car insurance, only that with this you have a choice on whether to have it or not.  Save your money and put it into a savings account for your pet!
title: I ended up paying about $2200 for…

text:
All the reviews looked great until I actually received this insurance. I took my dog in for a tummyache during the first two week waiting period, and understood he couldn’t get it covered during that time. However, I was shocked to hear that SPOT pet insurance we consider that a pre-existing condition. That’s right...an upset stomach from eating grass (new dog owner so didn’t know this is common), is considered pre-existing condition, which meant that for the next SIX months they wouldn’t cover any medical accident or ill as involving his stomach. And then, when I politely asked to cancel my insurance, I got an automated response telling me that it was canceled. Yes that is what I wanted, but to not receive a personalized message or at least an attempt to keep me as a customer or understand the problem was wildly disappointing. Would absolutely not recommend.

EDIT: in response to their response, It’s one thing to respect a user’s desire to cancel, but whether a company tries to keep their customers and actually fix their issues before letting them go says a lot about their customer service philosophy. And regarding the pre-existing conditions, the issue is the fact that you would consider an isolated upset stomach situation as a pre-existing condition. I hope others have had a better experience, but regardless I recommend the company take ownership over their areas of improvement.
title: Very disappointed

text:
I wish I could say SPOT will have your back, but I can’t…

We purchased the policy when my puppy was 3 months old. He got into trouble and swallowed rocks twice: once before and once during the insurance waiting period. The first time, he went to the ER for an endoscopy to remove them from his stomach. The second time the Dr made him puke it out. He had diarrhea for a couple weeks after due to all these procedures, but it went away after some time. It was all paid out of pocket ($4K) because the policy wasn’t active at this time. Too bad timing didn’t work out but that was the rules we agreed to, no hard feelings there.

After the waiting period was over, our dog started causing destruction around the house when left alone. He bit entire corners off the walls and literally ate two holes through the wall when left alone inside a gated kitchen for less than 1 hr. We consulted with the vet and they wrote a letter diagnosing separation anxiety and recommending behavioral treatment, which SPOT claims is covered.

We submitted the letter from the Dr and letter from an animal behaviorist outlining a treatment plan to SPOT for approval. They denied coverage claiming that eating rocks when he’s with us is a sign of separation anxiety and is therefore a pre-existing condition. I argued it is unreasonable to claim that a behavior observed when accompanied is a symptom of separation anxiety, but they disagreed. They also disagreed with the Dr’s letter that, literally and word by word, states the diagnosis for separation anxiety is unrelated to eating rocks. SPOT formulated their own diagnosis for my dog that justifies rejection of coverage and denied the claim.
 
At some point the diarrhea came back and lasted for weeks. The vet put him on medication for a month but wasn’t getting better so they recommended doing a full blood panel to diagnose any physical issues. SPOT rejected coverage for the vet’s medication, the blood panel and diagnostic tests claiming that because he had diarrhea before, it is a pre-existing condition and no treatment would be covered.

I’m not one to leave bitter reviews around the internet but I at least felt I had to share my experience and warn others.
title: I wish I could say SPOT will have your back, but i can't...

I did some research and decided this was the one as I live in NYC and things can get pretty expensive; I purchased the annual one time payment because that's just how I prefer to pay. I hope I won't ever have to use it but just in case I do, I'll be prepared.
